page.title: 10A Typical day in Halewood.
page.content: My name is Lindsey. I am ten years old. I get up at eight o'clock, get washed and dressed and go downstairs to get my breakfast. I then clean my teeth, rush downstairs and run to school. After the register we all go into assembly where one of the teachers tells us a story. We also have a hymn and a prayer. We do lots of different lessons each day. We do a lot of maths and English. Our other lessons are history, geography, science, art, P.E. games, music and scripture. On Fridays I stay behind to do gymnastics. When I get home I call for my friend Caroline. We play in my bedroom or we go outside. After my dogs have had their tea Caroline and I take them for a walk. I go in at about half past eight and I go to bed at ten o'clock.
